title: Namal criticises NPP’s change of stance on Indian, Chinese deals
byline: While commending President Anura Kumara Dissanayake for completing successful visits to India and China, SLPP MP Namal Rajapaksa expressed irony over the President’s decision to sign deals with Indian and Chinese companies that the National People’s Power (NPP) had previously criticised as ’’corrupt’’ during their time in the Opposition.

title: Badulla-Colombo online seat reservation time reduced to 30 seconds
byline: Despite recent actions, the Railways Department has revealed that groups involved in the online seat reservation racket continue to operate through the booking system.

title: Will visit UAE as next official visit: President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today he will leave for the United Arab Emirates (UAE) as his next official visit.

title: Victor Ivan passes away
byline: An investigative journalist, political critic, a theorist, social activist and an author, Victor Ivan passed away at the age of 75 years.

title: Possible floods in Malwathu Oya Basin
byline: The Irrigation Department issued a possible flood warning for those living closer to the Malwathu Oya Basin.

title: No schools in Eastern Province tomorrow
byline: The Provincial Education Department of the Eastern Province has decided not to hold schools in the province tomorrow (20) due to the prevailing bad weather.

title: Shooting in Mt. Lavinia linked to underworld dispute kills one
byline: Investigations have revealed that the fatal shooting of a 24-year-old man in Mount Lavinia today was the result of a long-standing feud between two notorious criminals, ’Kos Malli’ and ’Badovita Asanka’.

title: Around 100mm heavy rains expected within 24 hours
byline: With the further continuation of the rainy conditions in the Northern, North-Central, Eastern, Uva and Central Provinces for the next 24 hours, 100 mm of rain can be expected in the Eastern and Uva Provinces and in the Matale, Nuwara-Eliya and Polonnaruwa districts.

title: Navy stands ready with relief teams to respond to flood emergency
byline: As severe weather conditions threaten several areas in the island, the Sri Lanka Navy said 50 Navy relief teams are on standby, prepared to be deployed immediately to assist the public in the event of floods.

title: Trump launches cryptocurrency with price rocketing
byline: US President-elect Donald Trump has launched his own cryptocurrency, which quickly soared in market capitalisation to several billion dollars.

title: TikTok goes offline in the US hours before ban due to come in
byline: TikTok has gone offline in the US, hours before a new law banning the platform was due to come into effect.

title: Vijith Vijayamuni Soysa arrested
byline: Former Minister Vijith Vijayamuni Soysa was arrested by the Walana Anti-Vice Unit.

title: New vehicles for all MPs in the coming months: NPP MP
byline: National People’s Power (NPP) Kurunegala District MP Dharmapriya Dissanayake said that all members of parliament will soon be provided with new vehicles.

title: Sri Lanka crush Malaysia by 139 runs in T20 World Cup opener
byline: Hosts Malaysia were dismissed for just 23 runs in their maiden Under-19 Women’s T20 World Cup appearance, as Sri Lanka secured a massive 139-run victory in the first of two games on Sunday in Kuala Lumpur.

title: Fuel tanker explosion kills dozens of people in Nigeria
byline: A tanker has exploded after crashing in Nigeria, killing 77 people who had rushed to collect fuel from the scene, authorities say.

title: Over 35 injured in bus collision in Gandara
byline: At least 35 passengers were injured and hospitalised following a head-on collision between two buses in Gandara, on the Matara-Tangalla main road.

title: Govt. launches paddy procurement, Army assists in facility renovations
byline: The government is to launch a programme for purchasing paddy from the upcoming Maha season harvest.

title: AG assures Supreme Court of review on unaddressed complaints in Pastor Jerome hate speech case
byline: The Attorney General yesterday (17) provided an undertaking before the Supreme Court that any further complaints not yet considered could be forwarded by the petitioners to the Attorney General and these complaints will be reviewed when making a final and independent decision regarding potential action against Pastor Jerome Fernando in connection with alleged hate speech undermining religious harmony in the country.

title: Eluwankulam entrance to Wilpattu National Park closed
byline: The Eluwankulam entrance gate to the Wilpattu National Park has been closed to local and foreign tourists until further notice due to the recent heavy rains and the overflowing of the Kala Oya.
